PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Contact
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: One of the most common methods of disease transmission, reduced by practicing cleanliness and good hand hygiene.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Outdoors vector-borne
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This disease spreads via a vector--too small to see--that prefers outdoor spaces.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Indoors vector-borne
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This disease spreads via a vector--too small to see--that prefers enclosed spaces.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Underground vector-borne
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This disease spreads via a vector--too small to see--that prefers underground environments.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Food-borne
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This disease is spread when a pawn consumes part of the prior host. Most diseases can't spread between animals and humans, so usually this only affects cannibabls.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Memetic
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This contagion is spread by ideas: quarantine pawns with this disease, and don't let them interact with other pawns.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Proximity
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This disease is spread by close proximity, and encompasses multiple transmission methods, such as airborne, droplet borne, and contact. It can occasionally spread through doors, but not walls.

PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.label: Venereal
PrimumDisease.PD_TransmissionDef.description: This disease is spread via sexual contact.
